subject: RE: [junit] How can I write test case before write concrete cless
msgSnippet: Weiming, I can think of several ways you could write your tests. You could write the test with an example of a concrete class and use constructors: IMoney
messageBody:
Weiming,

I can think of several ways you could write your tests. You could write the
test with an example of a concrete class and use constructors:

IMoney addend= new Money(5, "CHF");

You could use factories:

IMoney addend= fiveFrancs();
or
IMoney addend= MoneyFactory.fiveFrancs();

The principle I use in such cases is to defer design decisions as long as
possible. I would start with the variables being declared with a concrete
class, then introduce interfaces once they would help the code:

Money addend= new Money(5, "CHF");

Sincerely yours,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute
